items.title: Methadone Dispensing Machines: Surveillance Tech in Addiction Treatment
items.content_html: Methadone-dispensing machines represent a technological intervention in medication-assisted therapy, costing clinics between $7-10k per unit. These digital surveillance devices enable the precise monitoring of patient consumption, tracking dosage and time of consumption. Under the ostensible aims of preventing diversion and ensuring treatment adherence, these machines reflect healthcare institutions' prioritization of control and data collection over interpersonal care.
items.content_text: Methadone-dispensing machines represent a technological intervention in medication-assisted therapy, costing clinics between [$7-10k](https://ph.parker.com/us/en/200-meth-system?t) per unit. These digital surveillance devices enable the precise monitoring of patient consumption, tracking dosage and time of consumption. Under the ostensible aims of preventing diversion and ensuring treatment adherence, these machines reflect healthcare institutions' prioritization of control and data collection over interpersonal care.

items.title: Chanel Beads ‚Äî Your Day Will Come (2024)
All drug use is adaptive in the beginning üí¨
items.content_html:
‚ÄúWhether used for recreation, escape, or mental enhancement, the initial use of drugs is most often adaptive, that is, beneficial in some way. A person uses the drug, perhaps only out of curiosity, to gain an effect that is experienced as positive. Those who continue to ‚Äúchase the first high,‚Äù and who develop problems associated with continued drug or alcohol use, are typically people who lack a fuller repertoire of adaptive skills than their peers.‚Äù

Denning, P., & Little, J. (2012). Practicing harm reduction psychotherapy: An alternative approach to addictions (2nd ed.). The Guilford Press.
items.content_text:
> ‚ÄúWhether used for recreation, escape, or mental enhancement, the initial use of drugs is most often adaptive, that is, beneficial in some way. A person uses the drug, perhaps only out of curiosity, to gain an effect that is experienced as positive. Those who continue to ‚Äúchase the first high,‚Äù and who develop problems associated with continued drug or alcohol use, are typically people who lack a fuller repertoire of adaptive skills than their peers.‚Äù

Denning, P., & Little, J. (2012). *Practicing harm reduction psychotherapy: An alternative approach to addictions* (2nd ed.). The Guilford Press.

items.title: Medetomidine
items.content_html:
Medetomidine is a veterinary anesthetic drug that has been found in samples of street drugs in the US since 2022. Like xylazine, medetomidine is a potent sedative that is not approved for use in humans.

Also like xylazine, it is an alpha 2-adrenergic agonist which is thought to mimic the longer-lasting sedation associated with actual heroin.

The inclusion of this drug and xylazine in the dope supply has complicated overdose response. These drugs cause heavy sedation and increase the amount of respiratory depression that individuals experience. Since they’re not opioids,1 they don’t respond to naloxone.

  1. Well, at least not in the way we’re thinking. link ↩︎
items.content_text:
**Medetomidine** is a veterinary anesthetic drug that has been found in samples of street drugs in the US since 2022. Like [xylazine](xylazine "wikilink"), medetomidine is a potent sedative that is **not** approved for use in humans.

Also like xylazine, it is an alpha 2-adrenergic agonist which is thought to mimic the longer-lasting sedation associated with *actual* heroin.

The inclusion of this drug and [xylazine](xylazine "wikilink") in the dope supply has complicated overdose response. These drugs cause heavy sedation and increase the amount of respiratory depression that individuals experience. Since they're not opioids,[^1] they don't respond to [naloxone](naloxone "wikilink").

[^1]: Well, at least not in the way we're thinking.
[link](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2772392524000142)

items.title: How people get stuck in Kensington
items.content_html:
After you get well, which can take a few bags if you’re a regular user, you’ll probably get an hour or two before it’s mostly worn off and it’s a race against time before you start feeling sick. The folks who’ve been using for a while will tell you that back when was heroin was good, you only needed a bag in the morning to stay well throughout the day. The withdrawal, while still agonizing, apparently didn’t hold a candle to what’s it’s like to detox from fentanyl (and now xylazine).

This is one of the factors that causes people to get stuck in Kensington.

See: The drugs in Kensington are cheap and plentiful

The folks who've been using for a while will tell you that back when was heroin was good, you only needed a bag in the morning to stay well throughout the day. The withdrawal, while still agonizing, apparently didn't hold a candle to what's it's like to detox from [fentanyl](fentanyl "wikilink") (and now [xylazine](xylazine "wikilink")).

See: [The drugs in Kensington are cheap and plentiful](https://flem.micro.blog/2024/11/18/the-drugs-in.html)

items.title: The drugs in Kensington are cheap and plentiful
items.content_html:
In Kensington, dope is so cheap and the customer base so reliable, that dealers often give the stuff away for free. When this happens, word travels quickly, and it’s not an uncommon sight to see 20-30 people suddenly rushing in the same direction.

When you do have to pay for it, you’re usually looking at $5 for a bag. Sometimes they’ll have bags for a dollar, though this isn’t the norm, and you can assume that a $1 bag of any drug isn’t going to be the purest thing on the market.

See: How people get stuck in Kensington
items.content_text:

When you do have to pay for it, you're usually looking at $5 for a bag. Sometimes they'll have bags for a dollar, though this isn't the norm, and you can assume that a $1 bag of any drug isn't going to be the purest thing on the market.

See: [How people get stuck in Kensington](how-people-get.html "wikilink")
